title: Which is correct, 'give the meaning of the following words or ' give the meanings of the following words'? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you were to ask “give the meaning of the following words” then you’d be asking for what the meaning of the entirety of the words are. For an example, if you asked it after someone said “She isn’t up to the standards we require of an actress.”, then you’d be asking what that meant, what specifically they meant by her not being up to the standards; Is she too unskilled, not attractive enough? If you were to ask “give the meanings of the following words” then you’d be asking for the definitions. For an example, if someone were to say “Cease opination on antecedent topics”, then you’d be asking the definition for the words ‘opination’, ‘antecedent’, ‘cease’, ‘topics’, and ‘on’. Does this help? Do you need further clarification?

Analytically, it would be “meanings,” of course. “Please give the meanings of the following words…” However, if people are focused on one question or one statement about a series of items, that might prompt saying things like, “Please check the spelling of the following words…” or “Please tell me the origin of the following expressions…” I’m fairly sure I’d say “Please tell me the colors of the shirts that you picked out for me.” But I think I might also say, “Please tell me the cost of the menu items that you’re suggesting…” even though I would expect to hear a different cost for each item. I realize this is dangerous advice to give, but when in doubt, go with what sounds right.
